warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Clasp hands behind back and gently straighten arms, holding for 30 seconds. Then, interlock fingers behind head and gently pull elbows back, holding for 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Raise one arm overhead and bend at the elbow, placing hand behind the head. Use the other hand to gently pull the elbow closer to the head, holding for 30 seconds. Repeat on the other side.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet together, arms at sides.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Jump, spreading legs and raising arms overhead. Return to starting position. Perform for 60 seconds.

exercises.setup: Adjust the machine seat so that your back is comfortably supported.  Position yourself so that your shoulders are aligned with the handles. Grip the handles firmly.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit upright with your back firmly against the backrest. Grip the handles, ensuring your elbows are slightly bent.
2. The Press: Extend your arms to push the handles away from your chest. Keep your back flat against the backrest throughout the movement.
3. Full Extension: Fully extend your arms, squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Controlled Return: Slowly return to the starting position, feeling the stretch in your chest muscles.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
2. Lowering the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows slightly flared out. Touch your chest with the bar.
3. Pressing Up: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Squeeze your chest muscles at the top.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain control throughout the movement, avoiding bouncing the bar off your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.

exercises.setup: Adjust the bench to an incline of approximately 30-45 degrees. Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the incline bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
2. Lowering the Dumbbells: Slowly lower the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping your elbows slightly flared out. Touch your chest with the dumbbells.
3. Pressing Up: Push the dumbbells back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Squeeze your chest muscles at the top.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain control throughout the movement, avoiding bouncing the dumbbells off your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the cable machine to a comfortable height. Sit on the seat and grip the handles.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit upright with your back straight. Grip the handles, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
2. Fly Movement: Extend your arms outwards, keeping a slight bend in your elbows. Squeeze your chest muscles at the end of the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly return to the starting position, feeling the stretch in your chest muscles.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Maintain a stable position to enhance mind-muscle connection.

exercises.setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper chest. Keep your back straight and core engaged.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper chest. Keep your back straight and core engaged.
2. Lifting: Press the barbell straight overhead, fully extending your arms. Keep your elbows slightly bent.
3. Lowering: Slowly lower the barbell back to your upper chest, maintaining control.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a stable core and avoid arching your back. Keep your elbows slightly in front of your body.

exercises.setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell with a narrow grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
2. Lowering the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Touch your chest with the bar.
3. Pressing Up: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Squeeze your triceps at the top.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain control throughout the movement, avoiding bouncing the bar off your chest.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Attach a straight bar to a cable machine. Stand facing the machine, gripping the bar with an overhand grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing the cable machine, gripping the bar with an overhand grip. Keep your elbows close to your body.
2. Pressing Down: Push the bar down towards your thighs, fully extending your arms. Squeeze your triceps at the bottom.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 repetitions with good form. Increase the weight in subsequent sets if possible.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum. Keep your elbows close to your body throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Position the cable at a low setting and use a bar attachment. Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand facing away from the cable machine with arms overhead, holding the bar attachment. Keep your elbows close to your head.
2. Extension: Extend your arms downwards, fully extending your elbows. Squeeze your triceps at the bottom.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control.
4. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your elbows close to your head.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your elbows close to your head.
2. Lowering the Bar: Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your elbows close to your head.  Arc the bar behind your head for better tension.
3. Pressing Up: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Squeeze your triceps at the top.
4. Controlled Movement: Maintain control throughout the movement, avoiding bouncing the bar off your forehead.
5. Repeat: Perform the desired number of repetitions while maintaining proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 repetitions with good form.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum. Keep your elbows close to your head throughout the exercise.
